meanings.definition: A sheet of paper at the front and back of a book.
meanings.sent1: The endpaper protects the book covers.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the endpaper was torn in my favorite novel.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the endpaper was a great place to hide.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an endpaper, holding the story of her life together.
meanings.sent5: The endpaper, with its crisp edges, signaled the beginning of a new adventure.

meanings.definition: The paper used to line the inside covers of a book.
meanings.sent1: The endpaper had a lovely floral pattern.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the texture of the endpaper under my fingertips.
meanings.sent3: The endpaper whispered secrets to the pages it guarded.
meanings.sent4: His words were like the endpaper, providing a protective layer to his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The endpaper crinkled softly as I turned the page, adding to the reading experience.
